page.title: 09The Cross in Irthlingborough
page.content: At the cross roads in Irthlingborough, where the old A6 meets the High Street, there is a traffic island. In the middle of that island is "The Cross". The cross stands on a tiered octagonal base which is 366 cms wide and the total height of the eight steps is 222 cms. The shaft of the cross itself measures nearly 4 metres high and stands on a large stone base. The shaft is square shaped and decorated with nine carved balls on each edge. What ever decorated the top of the cross has long since disappeared. The original purpose of the cross was something to do with measuring land but no one really knows how or why it was built. It is thought to have been built in the late 13th century, about 1280, although there is no accurate record.
